div2.p: Be it remembered that heretofore towit on the fourteenth day of November in the year of our Lord one thousand seven hundred and ninety Teresa Shorter by Gabriel Duvall her attorney prefers to the Courth here her petition for Freedom against Joseph Boarman in form following towit.
To the honurable the Judges of the General Court.

The petition of Teresa Shorter humbly sheweth, that she is held as a Slave by Joseph Boarman of Charles County, although she is entitled to her freedom being descended from a free woman your petitioner is the daughter of Lucy Shorter, who was the daughter of Jane Shorter who was the Daughter of Elizabeth Shorter a free woman She therefore prayeth that your honours would take her case into consideration and discharge her from the custody of the aforesaid Joseph Boarman and that Summonses may issue for her Witness and soforth.

Thereupon it is ordered by the Court here that that the writ of the State of Maryland of Subpena ad respondendum issue against the said Joseph Boarman to answer unto the said petition and so forth, and the same accordingly issues directed to the Sheriff of Charles County in form following towit
